item.title: The Royal Nevada: A Short, Sparkling Reign on Vintage Las Vegas Strip History
item.description:
A Crown Briefly Adorning the Strip

The 1950s were a whirlwind of growth for Las Vegas, and the Strip was ground zero for this rapid expansion. Amidst the boom, the Royal Nevada Hotel and Casino appeared in 1955, a bold attempt to carve out a space for itself. Originally planned as the “Sunrise Hotel,” the name was changed, and the grand vision of hotelier Frank Fishman became a reality – albeit a short one. Its April 19, 1955, opening marked the debut of the Strip’s eighth resort.
